SEARCH
Package com.ccprog3.myfarm

Class Game

java.lang.Object
com.ccprog3.myfarm.Game
public class Game extends Object
The main game class with all game elements present. This is where all the cool stuff happen.
Author:
John Joseph F. Giron

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int boardWidth, int boardHeight, float coins)
      Game constructor with specific board size and starting coins.
      Parameters:
      boardWidth - Board width
      boardHeight - Board height
      coins - Starting number of coins

    • Game

      public Game(int boardWidth, int boardHeight)
      Game constructor with specific board size
      Parameters:
      boardWidth - Board width
      boardHeight - Board height

    • Game

      public Game()
      Default game constructor with default settings of the game:
      10 x 5 board dimension.
      100 coins

  • Method Details

    • nextDay

      public void nextDay()
      Advances the game's day. The crops ages when this function is invoked.

    • plant

      public void plant(Ground ground, Crop seed)
      Plants a seed. It takes the ground object and the seed object.
      Parameters:
      ground - References to the game's already made ground
      seed - The chosen seed created in the Action class

    • removeCrop

      public void removeCrop(Ground ground)
      Removes the crop/seed in the given ground. Just sets the Crop field of the ground to null. This is used in harvesting and shoveling.
      Parameters:
      ground - The ground of the crop.

    • clearBoard

      public void clearBoard()
      Removes the ground's crop or the rock, and clears the plow status.

    • checkCropPresence

      public boolean checkCropPresence(Ground ground)
      Checks if the ground has a seed/crop. Useful for rock spawning.
      Parameters:
      ground -
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is a seed/crop. Also returns to true for the withered crop. Returns false if the ground is empty or has a rock.

    • getBoard

      public Ground[][] getBoard()
      A 2D array of the ground.
      Returns:
      A 2D array of the ground.

    • checkGameOver

      public boolean checkGameOver()
      This is the actual "game over".
      Returns:
      returns true if the game meets all the conditions (e.g. no more free ground) to end the game.

    • resetLoseCondition

      public void resetLoseCondition()
      Resets the bitmap lose condition.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer()
      The main player. For player's data manipulation.
      Returns:
      Returns the game's player object

    • getNameCoin

      public String getNameCoin()
      The name of the currency. Only the coder can change the name of the currency. For the MCO purposes, it returns "Objectcoin".
      Returns:
      Returns the String name of the currency.

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      The game's day number. Returns the game's recent day.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer that represents the game's current day.

    • checkFreeGround

      public boolean checkFreeGround()
      Checks if there are still empty ground. Both crops (and withered crops) and rocks must not be there to be counted! Plowed ground is also counted. Used for game over condition checking.
      Returns:
      Returns true if there are still free ground. False if the game runs out of free ground.

    • spawnRocks

      public final void spawnRocks()
      Spawns rocks. Used the random generator to choose whether to spawn a rock or not for each ground.

    • spawnRocks

      public final void spawnRocks(String rockString)
      Spawns rocks. Loads the csv file and read it. The 1 means that tile has a rock.
